titleStmt.title: A. C. Ellis to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10955

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Covington Ky Oct. 3. 1861
Hon. B. McGoffin.
Dear Sir

enclosed. I send you a Copy of the Judgt agst. Henry Helman. and a Petition signed by many of the most worthy citizens of of this City including several of the Jurors the Comths atty & Jailor asking your Excellency to remit the Same except the fees and costs. I Sincerely hope your Excellency will grant the prayer of the petition. I remain very Respectfully Your obt. Servt --

State of Kentucky
Kenton Circuit Court
Sept Term Sept. 12. 1861 --
Commonwealth
vs } Indictment for Selling liquor to a Minor --
Henry Helman
"The Jury having found Deft. Guilty, It is adjudged that Defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth in the Sum of $5000 and the Costs herein expended"

A Copy Att
N B Stephens Clerk
By A C. Ellis D C
